Ternarity is Prosodic binarity ' by Jay I. Rifkin , analyzes ternary structures as prosodic words , building on Itô and Mester ( 1992 ) and Hewitt ( 1992 ) .Rifkin proposes that prosodic words are binary : they can be composed of two feet or a foot and an unparsed syllable .

The phonology - phonetics interface and Syllabic Theory ' , by Shosuke Haraguchi expands and revises Haraguchi 1998 Set Theory of the Syllable ( STS ) .This theory assumes that syllables consist underlyingly of unordered sets of features , with ordering determined by principles of linearization and phonetic implementation .
